qas.question: In what neighborhood does the Halloween Parade take place?
What company sponsors the Thanksgiving Day parade?
At what location is a Christmas tree famously lit every year?
Where in Central Park are performances offered at no cost?
In what borough is the Unisphere located?

context: Major tourist destinations include Times Square; Broadway theater productions; the Empire State Building; the Statue of Liberty; Ellis Island; the United Nations Headquarters; museums such as the Metropolitan Museum of Art; greenspaces such as Central Park and Washington Square Park; <a2_0>Rockefeller Center<a2_0/>; the Manhattan Chinatown; luxury shopping along Fifth and Madison Avenues; and events such as the Halloween Parade in <a0_0>Greenwich Village<a0_0/>; the <a1_0>Macy's<a1_0/> Thanksgiving Day Parade; the lighting of the Rockefeller Center Christmas Tree; the St. Patrick's Day parade; seasonal activities such as ice skating in Central Park in the wintertime; the Tribeca Film Festival; and free performances in Central Park at <a3_0>Summerstage<a3_0/>. Major attractions in the boroughs outside Manhattan include Flushing Meadows-Corona Park and the Unisphere in <a4_0>Queens<a4_0/>; the Bronx Zoo; Coney Island, Brooklyn; and the New York Botanical Garden in the Bronx. The New York Wheel, a 630-foot ferris wheel, was under construction at the northern shore of Staten Island in 2015, overlooking the Statue of Liberty, New York Harbor, and the Lower Manhattan skyline.
